<div class="post-content cf entry-content content-spacious">
<p><em>AAVI</em> recently hosted an exclusive webinar, in association with <a href="https://www.henkel-adhesives.com/uk/en.html">Henkel Adhesives</a>, titled ‘<em>Driving performance, efficiency and reliability: Material solutions for vehicle domain controllers</em>‘. Don’t worry if you missed it – as you can still register (free) to watch the webinar at a time of your convenience, by simply clicking <a href="https://register.visitcloud.com/survey/0wojwmu6qt9sz/register">here</a>.</p>
<p>Vehicle domain controllers (VDCs) are driving the next generation of automotive innovation – enabling centralized control, improved system efficiency and greater design flexibility – while aiding in AI advancements. This webinar highlights how Henkel’s advanced material solutions are specifically designed to support and optimize VDC performance. From thermal management solutions to underfill, gasketing and more, discover how Henkel materials enable reliable, high-performance operation in demanding automotive environments. <a href="https://register.visitcloud.com/survey/0wojwmu6qt9sz/register">Watch now</a> to explore the critical role materials play in powering the future of connected, electrified vehicles.</p>
<h4>Speakers:</h4>
<p><strong>• <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/nancy-yang-henkel/">Nancy Yang</a>,</strong> business development manager, Automotive Electronics</p>
<p><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" class="size-thumbnail wp-image-20721 alignleft" src="https://www.autonomousvehicleinternational.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/nancy-yang-headshot-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" />Nancy Yang is business development manager for Automotive Electronics, Henkel Adhesive Technologies, North America. Her role revolves around the development of cutting-edge thermal solutions, EMI shielding, underfills, nano coatings, adhesives and more.</p>
<p> </p>
<p> </p>
<p><strong>• Neil Poole</strong>, expert application engineering, Automotive Electronics</p>
<p><img loading="lazy" decoding="async" class="size-thumbnail wp-image-20722 alignleft" src="https://www.autonomousvehicleinternational.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/04/Poole_25-1-150x150.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" />Dr Neil Poole, application engineering expert in Henkel’s Automotive Electronics applications engineering group, is responsible for supporting all of Henkel’s electronics materials product portfolio, specializing in working with key global customers. He graduated with a BSc and PhD from the University of Edinburgh in Scotland. Since then, he has held a variety of positions both in general chemicals R&D, gaining several patents, and in electronic materials, in which he has been working for the last 25 years. He has authored multiple papers on such diverse topics as heterogeneous catalysis, printing surface mount adhesives, solder joint reliability and underfills.</p>
<p><strong>WATCH NOW</strong></p>
<p><strong> </strong><a href="https://register.visitcloud.com/survey/0wojwmu6qt9sz/register">Please click here to access the registration form, fill out your details, and then view the webinar at your convenience.</a></p>

text:
AAVI recently hosted an exclusive webinar, in association with Henkel Adhesives, titled ‘Driving performance, efficiency and reliability: Material solutions for vehicle domain controllers‘. Don’t worry if you missed it – as you can still register (free) to watch the webinar at a time of your convenience, by simply clicking here.

Vehicle domain controllers (VDCs) are driving the next generation of automotive innovation – enabling centralized control, improved system efficiency and greater design flexibility – while aiding in AI advancements. This webinar highlights how Henkel’s advanced material solutions are specifically designed to support and optimize VDC performance. From thermal management solutions to underfill, gasketing and more, discover how Henkel materials enable reliable, high-performance operation in demanding automotive environments. Watch now to explore the critical role materials play in powering the future of connected, electrified vehicles.

Speakers:

• Nancy Yang, business development manager, Automotive Electronics

Nancy Yang is business development manager for Automotive Electronics, Henkel Adhesive Technologies, North America. Her role revolves around the development of cutting-edge thermal solutions, EMI shielding, underfills, nano coatings, adhesives and more.

• Neil Poole, expert application engineering, Automotive Electronics

Dr Neil Poole, application engineering expert in Henkel’s Automotive Electronics applications engineering group, is responsible for supporting all of Henkel’s electronics materials product portfolio, specializing in working with key global customers. He graduated with a BSc and PhD from the University of Edinburgh in Scotland. Since then, he has held a variety of positions both in general chemicals R&D, gaining several patents, and in electronic materials, in which he has been working for the last 25 years. He has authored multiple papers on such diverse topics as heterogeneous catalysis, printing surface mount adhesives, solder joint reliability and underfills.

WATCH NOW

Please click here to access the registration form, fill out your details, and then view the webinar at your convenience.

The good news is that it's available to watch anytime—just click here to register at no cost.

Delve into how Vehicle Domain Controllers (VDCs) are revolutionizing automotive tech. They're centralizing control systems, boosting efficiency, enhancing design flexibility, and paving the way for AI advancements. In this insightful webinar, discover how Henkel's top-notch material innovations ensure VDCs perform reliably even in tough conditions—from managing heat efficiently to offering robust gasketing options. Don't miss out on understanding the pivotal role materials play as vehicles become more connected and electrified.

Spotlight Speakers:
- Nancy Yang brings her expertise as Business Development Manager in Automotive Electronics at Henkel Adhesive Technologies North America. She focuses on innovative thermal management solutions among other cutting-edge technologies.
  
- Dr Neil Poole leads with his extensive experience in application engineering within Automotive Electronics at Henkel. An alumnus of the University of Edinburgh with a rich background across general chemicals R&D and electronics materials innovation over 25 years.
